page.title: 16Fakenham School Barbeque
page.content: On 13th July 1985 we had a barbeque at the Infant School. Some of the parents cooked beefburgers and hot dogs for us to buy and there was a selection of savoury dips with carrot sticks, celery and cucumber. There was cola and lemonade for the children and wine or cider for the adults. When we first arrived we played punch-ball rounders or football. In the rounders the adults bowled and fielded and the children batted by punching the ball. After the games and food we had country dancing with instructions called out for those who didn't know the dances. When we were worn out, Mrs. Colman (one of our teachers) and her husband played their guitars so that we could all join in and sing. Most of us wore jeans or casual trousers or dungarees and T-shirts or sweatshirts.
